medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing lethargy, anorexia, and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 7 years prior with a diagnosis of autoimmune hepatitis, leading to increased lethargy, anorexia, and abdominal pain. About 3.5 months before admission, the patient experienced intermittent headaches, weakness, dizziness, fatigue, and increasing abdominal and ankle swelling. Symptoms worsened following discharge with exacerbated anorexia and leg edema, along with constant mid-abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of autoimmune hepatitis; diabetes mellitus type 2; hypertension; gastroesophageal reflux disease; previous procedures including transjugular intrahepatic porto-systemic shunt (TIPS) due to portal hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Born in Central America, spoke only Spanish, immigrated to the United States over 25 years ago. Did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
